XMLApplet
Class PieChart

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--XMLApplet.PieChart
public class PieChart
extends Object

PieChart allows the simple creation of pie charts using AWT. It gets the data to chart from a HashMap, and then all you need to tell it are the pixel locations where you want to plot the chart and it's legend.

It changes the Color of each pie slice according to the following order:

  1. Color.green
  2. Color.yellow
  3. Color.red
  4. Color.orange
  5. Color.cyan
  6. Color.pink
  7. Color.magenta
  8. Color.lightGray
  9. Color.white

If the number of slices exceeds the number of colors, the list cycles to the beginning.

Author:
Tim Cheadle

          Initializes the list of available slice colors and stores the series to chart.

Method Detail

draw

public void draw(Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int legendX,
                 int legendY)
Draws the pie chart and it's legend at the given coordinates using the given width and height.

Parameters:
g - Graphics object to draw to
x - X coordinate of the middle of the pie chart circle
y - Y coordinate of the middle of the pie chart circle
width - Width of the pie chart circle
height - Height of the pie chart circle
legendX - X coordinate of the top-left corner of the legend rectangle
legendY - Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the legend rectangle
See Also:
Graphics
